definition: the unfair treatment of people who belong to a different race; violent behaviour towards them

the belief that there are different races of people with different characteristics and abilities, and that some races are better than others; a general belief about a whole group of people based only on their race
hard boring work
working or doing something slowly and steadily, especially in a way that other people think is boring
the fact of producing many useful results; the extent to which something produces useful results
the fact of producing a lot of crops; the extent to which land, trees, etc. produce crops
writing that is arranged in lines, often with a regular rhythm or pattern of rhyme
a group of lines that form a unit in a poem or song
poetry
any one of the short numbered divisions of a chapter in the Bible

a part of a helmet that can be pulled down to protect the eyes and face

the stiff front part of a cap that sticks out above your eyes

a building with glass sides and a glass roof, for growing plants in; a type of large greenhouse
a military prison
in a way that uses or contains metaphors
a group of people who share a common feature or aspect of behaviour
a member of a group of people who support another person

a cruel action
something that happens that seems unfair
the leaves of the coriander plant, used in cooking as a herb
meat from the top part of a pig’s leg that has been cured (= preserved using salt or smoke)

the back part of a person’s leg above the knee
anything

sex between animals

an association or a club for people or organizations with the same interest

the act of joining two or more things together; the state of being joined together
a marriage
two people or things that work together or are placed together; the act of placing them together

the act of choosing when something happens; a particular point or period of time when something happens or is planned
the skill of doing something at exactly the right time
the repeated rhythm of something; the skill of producing this

not connected; not related to something else
not belonging to the same family

connected with cytoplasm

the process of sending somebody/something in different directions; the process of spreading something over a wide area

the membrane (= very thin layer of tissue) on the inside of the abdomen that covers the stomach and other organs

a politician who helps make the laws of a country
the act of giving food to a person, an animal or a plant

the process of changing so that there is greater variety

having a harmful effect

breeding (= producing young) between closely related people or animals

that you have stated and are discussing; particular
